title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns and operates Bay Area Sanitation, which runs almost 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025 and the video is a CNBC Make It piece.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, 31, founder/operator of Bay Area Sanitation
Fleet size: nearly 2,000 portable toilets
Service area: construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area
Revenue: $4.3 million total income in 2025
Published by CNBC Make It (production credits listed in description)
takeaways: Scale benchmark: a 2,000-unit fleet and $4.3M revenue offer a concrete reference for sanitation demand and vendor capacity on large projects.
Regional reliance: concentrated Bay Area operations underscore the value of local specialty service providers during construction and event builds.
Ongoing logistics: servicing construction sites/events implies predictable, recurring sanitation needs to account for in project planning.
Vendor selection: established, revenue-generating niche operators can be viable partners for site services and should be evaluated during procurement.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, route planning is made easy as Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups. The short clip highlights Copilot Groups as an AI-enabled way to simplify planning workflows and is tagged #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai.
bullets: Core message: route planning made easy.
Feature showcased: Copilot Groups.
Perspective: Jo discovers the feature's power.
Format: short demonstrative clip.
Included hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai.
takeaways: If Copilot Groups simplifies route planning, decision-makers should consider evaluating it for field crew coordination and dispatch.
Pilot-test Copilot Groups on a limited set of maintenance or outage routes to measure efficiency and routing accuracy before wider rollout.
Assess how Copilot Groups would integrate with existing operations and scheduling systems to avoid workflow disruption.
Review data access and security implications when using AI-driven group planning for critical infrastructure operations.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG ON AIR hosts Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discuss how AI is already integrated into audit workflows, enabling repetitive task automation, large-scale data analysis and better decision-making. They outline concrete tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), the shift from sampling to full-population analysis, benefits for clients, and implementation challenges including data security and regulatory issues.
bullets: AI automates repetitive audit tasks and enables analysis of full data populations, not just samples.
AI Transaction Scoring Tool analyzes entire populations; Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents.
KPMG Clara platform supports real-time audit management; Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
Adoption changes the auditor’s role and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Key implementation concerns include data security, regulatory environment and AI-related risks.
takeaways: Expect more comprehensive, data-driven audits (full-population analysis) that can surface operational issues in larger datasets.
Improved audit efficiency and clearer client communication may speed reporting and reduce time spent on routine checks.
Data security and regulatory compliance must be prioritized when sharing operational and infrastructure data with auditors using AI tools.
Plan for auditors’ evolving skill sets and collaboration models as AI shifts responsibilities toward analysis and judgment.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode, and links to the game and social channels are provided.
bullets: Official launch trailer for Arknights: Endfield, a 3D real-time strategy RPG.
Trailer emphasizes NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Description includes links to the game site and official social channels.
No transcript available for the video.
takeaways: Trailer demonstrates real-world use of NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation in a released title.
Footage was produced using a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode, indicating hardware/software pairing used for high-resolution capture.
Relevant facts for infrastructure teams: DLSS 4 MFG and 4K capture settings are part of current consumer content workflows.
Information and assets (links to the game and NVIDIA coverage) are provided for further technical details and verification.
